intro: Ilex rubrinervia, commonly known as the red-veined holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers followed by red berries that are edible for birds. Ilex rubrinervia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
